hypotheses.prediction: IF isolated mitoplasts (OMM-stripped) are exposed to Ca²⁺ (200 µM) + Pi (2 mM), THEN CsA-sensitive ΔΨm collapse occurs with identical EC₅₀ (±15%) compared to intact mitochondria, AND pre-treatment of intact mitochondria with VBIT-4 (20 µM) blocks VDAC1 oligomerization (>80% reduction by crosslinking/native PAGE) without preventing initial mPTP-driven ΔΨm loss (≤20% delay in onset).
hypotheses.experimental_protocol: Isolate liver mitochondria (mouse) and prepare mitoplasts by digitonin titration (0.1 mg/mg protein). Load with TMRM (100 nM) and Fluo-4 AM. Challenge with Ca²⁺ pulses (50-500 µM) ± CsA (1 µM) ± VBIT-4 (5, 10, 20 µM). Monitor ΔΨm by plate reader kinetics (1-s resolution, 30 min). At defined timepoints, crosslink with EGS (0.5 mM, 15 min) and run native PAGE/Western for VDAC1 oligomers. Compare intact mitochondria vs. mitoplasts.
hypotheses.expected_outcome: mPTP opens in mitoplasts lacking OMM/VDAC1; VBIT-4 blocks oligomerization but ΔΨm collapse onset is unchanged; CsA blocks both. Oligomerization appears 2-5 min after* initial ΔΨm drop.
hypotheses.null_outcome: VBIT-4 prevents or delays mPTP opening itself (>50% increase in calcium retention capacity), OR mitoplasts fail to show CsA-sensitive PT, indicating VDAC1 is required for initiation.
controls: digitonin titration verification by citrate synthase accessibility

hypotheses.prediction: IF mitochondria from mouse heart, brain cortex, and liver are subjected to sequential Ca²⁺ boluses (10 µM increments), THEN calcium retention capacity (CRC) before irreversible ΔΨm collapse follows: cardiac < neuronal < hepatic, with CRC values of 150-250, 250-400, and 400-700 nmol Ca²⁺/mg protein respectively, AND the Ca²⁺ load at which VDAC1 oligomers first appear (by crosslinking) correlates with CRC (r² > 0.7).
hypotheses.experimental_protocol: Isolate mitochondria from 8-week C57BL/6 mouse heart (Percoll gradient), cortical brain (ficoll), and liver (differential centrifugation), n=6 per tissue. Perform CRC assay with Calcium Green-5N (1 µM) in standard respiration buffer (125 mM KCl, 2 mM KH₂PO₄, 5 mM glutamate/malate), adding 10 µM Ca²⁺ pulses every 60 s. At each pulse, remove aliquot for EGS crosslinking + VDAC1 native PAGE. Quantify CypD by Western blot and cardiolipin by LC-MS/MS. Repeat ± CsA (1 µM) and ± VBIT-4 (20 µM).
hypotheses.expected_outcome: Cardiac mitochondria show lowest CRC, earliest VDAC1 oligomerization; hepatic highest CRC, latest oligomerization. CypD/ANT ratio inversely correlates with CRC. CsA equalizes CRC across tissues (±30%). VBIT-4 does not change CRC but delays oligomer appearance.
hypotheses.null_outcome: CRC values are statistically indistinguishable across tissues (ANOVA p>0.05), OR ranking differs from predicted (e.g., neuronal most resistant), OR VDAC1 oligomerization timing does not correlate with CRC.
controls: CypD-KO mouse mitochondria (positive control for CsA-insensitive component)

hypotheses.prediction: IF VDAC1 is genetically ablated (CRISPR triple-KO of VDAC1/2/3) in HeLa or MEF cells, THEN Ca²⁺ overload (ionomycin 5 µM + thapsigargin 2 µM) still triggers mPTP opening (CsA-sensitive ΔΨm loss), BUT death shifts from necrosis (>70% PI+/AnnexinV+ in WT) to apoptosis (>60% AnnexinV+/PI− in KO), with reduced LDH release (>50% reduction), maintained caspase-3 activation, and absence of mitochondrial swelling.
hypotheses.experimental_protocol: Generate VDAC1/2/3 triple-KO HeLa cells via sequential CRISPR-Cas9 (validated by Western blot and functional reconstitution). Treat WT and KO with ionomycin (2, 5, 10 µM) ± CsA (1 µM) or VBIT-4 (20 µM) for 2-8 h. Assess: (1) ΔΨm by TMRM live imaging, (2) death mode by AnnexinV-FITC/PI flow cytometry at 2, 4, 8 h, (3) LDH release (supernatant), (4) caspase-3/7 activity (luminescent assay), (5) mitochondrial swelling by TEM, (6) cytochrome c release by digitonin fractionation/Western. Include Bax/Bak DKO as apoptosis-
hypotheses.expected_outcome: VDAC-KO cells still undergo CsA-sensitive ΔΨm loss but die primarily by apoptosis (caspase-dependent, AnnexinV+/PI−, minimal swelling). WT cells show necrosis (PI+, LDH high, swollen mitochondria). CsA blocks both. VBIT-4 phenocopies KO in WT cells.
hypotheses.null_outcome: VDAC-KO cells show identical necrotic death kinetics and markers as WT (death mode independent of VDAC), OR VDAC-KO cells are completely resistant to Ca²⁺-induced death (VDAC required for mPTP itself).
controls: z-VAD-FMK (caspase inhibition to test necrosis default)
